messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Digest Number 544
messages.msgSnippet: I apologize for sending my message FOUR times, I was having trouble with my email.  I am sure reading it once was bad enough, but four times.  Sorry about
messages.messageBody:
I apologize for sending my message FOUR times, I was
having trouble with my email. I am sure reading it
once was bad enough, but four times. Sorry about
that.

Leslie
--- AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com wrote:
> ------------------------ Yahoo! Groups Sponsor
>
> To unsubscribe from this group, send an email to:
> AlwaysLearning-unsubscribe@yahoogroups.com

>
------------------------------------------------------------------------
>
> There are 8 messages in this issue.
>

> 1. Re: An article I wrote

> 2. Re: Adobe (Natural Building)
> From: Deborah Lewis <ddzimlew@...>
> 3. Re: Fwd: [unschoolingfamilies] Gift Idea???

>
> Message: 1
> Date: Sat, 28 Sep 2002 13:11:22 EDT
> From: KathrynJB@...
> Subject: Re: An article I wrote
>
> In a message dated 9/28/2002 12:32:47 PM Eastern
> Standard Time,
> AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com writes:
>
>
> > > If you're interested, please check it out.
> Here's the URL:
> > >
>
http://www.uua.org/re/faithworks/fall02/leadership/leadershipc.html
> >
> > Kathryn, that was great! You wrote out all the
> ideas I've had swirling
> > around in my head about RE that I haven't had time
> to express. Do you mind
> > if I forward it to our RE committee? They aren't
> quite as progressive as
> > yours -- well except for me ;-) -- but they seem
> to be on the brink of
> > seeing this themselves -- even if they do send
> their kids to school ;-)
> >
> >
> Oh, go for it!
> When I finish the damned book maybe they'll buy it
> ;)
> Kathryn
>
>
> [Non-text portions of this message have been
> removed]
>
>
>
>
________________________________________________________________________
>
________________________________________________________________________
>
> Message: 2
> Date: Sat, 28 Sep 2002 15:55:24 -0600
> From: Deborah Lewis <ddzimlew@...>
> Subject: Re: Adobe (Natural Building)
>
> Christian Bruyere and Robert Inwood wrote several
> books with line
> drawings about natural building. Maybe not the ones
> you're thinking of.
>
> We have "Country Comforts" and "In Harmony With
> Nature" and there is
> another we borrowed from a friend called "Creative
> Country
> Construction." They're all good, kinda funky, very
> fun to read and
> browse.
>
> Deb L
>
>
>
________________________________________________________________________
>
________________________________________________________________________
>
> Message: 3
> Date: Sat, 28 Sep 2002 18:04:02 EDT
> From: dacunefare@...
> Subject: Re: Fwd: [unschoolingfamilies] Gift Idea???
>
> I'm wondering why this toy is considered offensive?
> Or more offensive than a
> regular GI Joe?
>
> Modern warfare is street warfare, city warfare,
> house to house and building
> to building. This is exactly the face of war from
> the front page of the
> newspapers. Better for boys to play fantasy war?
> Desensitization? What?
>
> Deborah in IL
>
>
>
________________________________________________________________________
>
________________________________________________________________________
>
> Message: 4
> Date: Sat, 28 Sep 2002 17:00:26 -0600
> From: "Lisa Hardiman" <lisa-hardiman@...>
> Subject: RE: An article I wrote
>
> That article is beautiful. We are learning so much
> spirituality here
> all of us, since we are Homeschooling. There is a
> threshold of
> happiness here and fulfillment of ourselves and each
> other. I wish to
> belong to a fellowship like the one you described.
> Maybe one of these
> days. Lisa of MT
>
> -----Original Message-----

> Ren
